p: Super-resolution microscopy has been used in imaging telomere architecture and measuring telomere volume dynamics ( 6, 30–32). The complex scenario in a cell generated controversial observations ( 6, 31, 32). Single-molecule assays performed in vitro provided well-controlled experimental setups to examine the telomere dynamics upon interacting with shelterin and replication proteins ( 29, 33–35). Single-molecule mechanical tools, e.g. magnetic tweezers, have been used in the research of transcription and replication, providing deep insights into molecular mechanisms of protein-DNA interactions at a fork configuration ( 36, 37).
